channel.title: My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content on My New Hugo Site

item.description: They (the all knowing vendors who want to sell you more hardware for storage, software for backups, etc) always say you should follow the 3-2-1 rule for backups. I’ve never been good at this. So I set out on a mission. I wanted a backup system that was easy to deploy to my new servers and worked without a bunch of manual intervention. I built a simple web server that houses 2 scripts.

Cuz here we go again, starting a new blog. This is less about the blog itself and more about trying new stuff. I saw the idea of using Obsidian as a notes editor and publishing it with Hugo via GitHub to a site for semi automated posts. We will see how that goes. I tend to start the project and never finish it. Maybe this time I’ll try this as a journal of my ideas in my homelab.
